TITLE: Creating Authentication Session in Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python code creates an authentication session with Bluesky using the Client from atproto. It requires the user's handle and password.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/get-started.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from atproto import Client

client = Client()
client.login('handle.example.com', 'hunter2')
```

TITLE: Creating Authentication Session with CURL
DESCRIPTION: This CURL command creates an authentication session with Bluesky. It requires the user's handle, password, and PDS host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/get-started.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -X POST $PDSHOST/xrpc/com.atproto.server.createSession \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -d '{"identifier": "'"$BLUESKY_HANDLE"'", "password": "'"$BLUESKY_PASSWORD"'"}'
```

TITLE: Authenticating with Bluesky API in Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python snippet demonstrates how to authenticate with the Bluesky API by creating a session. It uses the requests library to send a POST request to the createSession endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-08-11-create-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import requests

BLUESKY_HANDLE = "example.bsky.social"
BLUESKY_APP_PASSWORD = "123-456-789"

resp = requests.post(
    "https://bsky.social/xrpc/com.atproto.server.createSession",
    json={"identifier": BLUESKY_HANDLE, "password": BLUESKY_APP_PASSWORD},
)
resp.raise_for_status()
session = resp.json()
print(session["accessJwt"])
```

TITLE: Uploading Images in Bluesky Posts - TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to upload and embed an image in a Bluesky post using TypeScript. Includes handling of image data, blob upload, and post creation with image metadata like alt text and aspect ratio.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/tutorials/creating-a-post.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const image = 'data:image/png;base64,...'
const { data } = await agent.uploadBlob(convertDataURIToUint8Array(image), {
  encoding,
})
await agent.post({
  text: 'I love my cat',
  embed: {
    $type: 'app.bsky.embed.images',
    images: [
      // can be an array up to 4 values
      {
        alt: 'My cat mittens', // the alt text
        image: data.blob,
        aspectRatio: {
          // a hint to clients
          width: 1000,
          height: 500
        }
    }],
  },
  createdAt: new Date().toISOString()
})
```

TITLE: Updating Bluesky Profile with TypeScript SDK
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to update a user's profile using the Bluesky TypeScript SDK. It shows the upsert operation that either creates a new profile or updates an existing one, focusing on changing the display name and description.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/tutorials/editing-profiles.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
await agent.upsertProfile(existingProfile => {
  const existing = existingProfile ?? {}

  existing.displayName = 'New display name who dis'
  existing.description = 'New bio who dis'

  return existing
})
```

TITLE: Parsing Facets and Resolving Handles to DIDs in Python for Bluesky
DESCRIPTION: This function parses mentions and URLs from text, resolves handles to DIDs using Bluesky's API, and formats the results into facet dictionaries. It handles unresolvable handles by skipping them and ensures proper formatting for both mentions and URLs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/post-richtext.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
def parse_facets(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    facets = []
    for m in parse_mentions(text):
        resp = requests.get(
            "https://bsky.social/xrpc/com.atproto.identity.resolveHandle",
            params={"handle": m["handle"]},
        )
        # If the handle can't be resolved, just skip it!
        # It will be rendered as text in the post instead of a link
        if resp.status_code == 400:
            continue
        did = resp.json()["did"]
        facets.append({
            "index": {
                "byteStart": m["start"],
                "byteEnd": m["end"],
            },
            "features": [{"$type": "app.bsky.richtext.facet#mention", "did": did}],
        })
    for u in parse_urls(text):
        facets.append({
            "index": {
                "byteStart": u["start"],
                "byteEnd": u["end"],
            },
            "features": [
                {
                    "$type": "app.bsky.richtext.facet#link",
                    # NOTE: URI ("I") not URL ("L")
                    "uri": u["url"],
                }
            ],
        })
    return facets
```

TITLE: Parsing Mentions and Links in Python
DESCRIPTION: Python functions to parse mentions and URLs in post text, identifying the byte positions for rich-text facets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import re
from typing import List, Dict

def parse_mentions(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    spans = []
    # regex based on: https://atproto.com/specs/handle#handle-identifier-syntax
    mention_regex = rb"[$|\W](@([a-zA-Z0-9]([a-zA-Z0-9-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?\.)+[a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?)"
    text_bytes = text.encode("UTF-8")
    for m in re.finditer(mention_regex, text_bytes):
        spans.append({
            "start": m.start(1),
            "end": m.end(1),
            "handle": m.group(1)[1:].decode("UTF-8")
        })
    return spans

def parse_urls(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    spans = []
    # partial/naive URL regex based on: https://stackoverflow.com/a/3809435
    # tweaked to disallow some training punctuation
    url_regex = rb"[$|\W](https?:\/\/(www\.)?[-a-zA-Z0-9@:%._\+~#=]{1,256}\.[a-zA-Z0-9()]{1,6}\b([-a-zA-Z0-9()@:%_\+.~#?&//=]*[-a-zA-Z0-9@%_\+~#//=])?)"
    text_bytes = text.encode("UTF-8")
    for m in re.finditer(url_regex, text_bytes):
        spans.append({
            "start": m.start(1),
            "end": m.end(1),
            "url": m.group(1).decode("UTF-8"),
        })
    return spans
```

TITLE: Processing Bluesky Firehose Events with a Sequential Scheduler in Go
DESCRIPTION: Implements an event handler for the Bluesky firehose that processes repository commit events sequentially. It prints information about each event and its operations, then uses a scheduler to handle the event stream in order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/firehose.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
rsc := &events.RepoStreamCallbacks{
  RepoCommit: func(evt *atproto.SyncSubscribeRepos_Commit) error {
    fmt.Println("Event from ", evt.Repo)
    for _, op := range evt.Ops {
      fmt.Printf(" - %s record %s\n", op.Action, op.Path)
    }
    return nil
  },
}

sched := sequential.NewScheduler("myfirehose", rsc.EventHandler)
events.HandleRepoStream(context.Background(), con, sched)
```

TITLE: Creating a Basic Post with Bluesky API in Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python snippet shows how to create a basic post using the Bluesky API. It constructs the post data, including the current timestamp, and sends a POST request to the createRecord endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-08-11-create-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import json
from datetime import datetime, timezone

now = datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat().replace("+00:00", "Z")

post = {
    "$type": "app.bsky.feed.post",
    "text": "Hello World!",
    "createdAt": now,
}

resp = requests.post(
    "https://bsky.social/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.createRecord",
    headers={"Authorization": "Bearer " + session["accessJwt"]},
    json={
        "repo": session["did"],
        "collection": "app.bsky.feed.post",
        "record": post,
    },
)
print(json.dumps(resp.json(), indent=2))
resp.raise_for_status()
```

TITLE: Authorization Request Flow Parameters
DESCRIPTION: Critical parameters required for the initial Pushed Authorization Request (PAR) to the authorization server including state token, PKCE challenge, scopes, client assertion, and DPoP requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/oauth-client.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
POST {pushed_authorization_request_endpoint}
Headers:
DPoP: {dpop_proof_jwt}
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Body:
state={random_state_token}&
code_challenge={pkce_challenge}&
code_challenge_method=S256&
scope=atproto&
client_assertion_type=urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer&
client_assertion={signed_jwt}&
login_hint={optional_account_identifier}
```

TITLE: Fetching and Embedding Website Card in Bluesky Social Post (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Python function to fetch website metadata, upload thumbnail image, and create a website card embed for a Bluesky Social post.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-08-11-create-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def fetch_embed_url_card(access_token: str, url: str) -> Dict:

    # the required fields for every embed card
    card = {
        "uri": url,
        "title": "",
        "description": "",
    }

    # fetch the HTML
    resp = requests.get(url)
    resp.raise_for_status()
    soup = BeautifulSoup(resp.text, "html.parser")

    # parse out the "og:title" and "og:description" HTML meta tags
    title_tag = soup.find("meta", property="og:title")
    if title_tag:
        card["title"] = title_tag["content"]
    description_tag = soup.find("meta", property="og:description")
    if description_tag:
        card["description"] = description_tag["content"]

    # if there is an "og:image" HTML meta tag, fetch and upload that image
    image_tag = soup.find("meta", property="og:image")
    if image_tag:
        img_url = image_tag["content"]
        # naively turn a "relative" URL (just a path) into a full URL, if needed
        if "://" not in img_url:
            img_url = url + img_url
        resp = requests.get(img_url)
        resp.raise_for_status()

        blob_resp = requests.post(
            "https://bsky.social/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.uploadBlob",
            headers={
                "Content-Type": IMAGE_MIMETYPE,
                "Authorization": "Bearer " + access_token,
            },
            data=resp.content,
        )
        blob_resp.raise_for_status()
        card["thumb"] = blob_resp.json()["blob"]

    return {
        "$type": "app.bsky.embed.external",
        "external": card,
    }
```

TITLE: Implementing Homepage with Feed List
DESCRIPTION: React component that fetches and displays the top 10 custom feeds from Bluesky using the configured API client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/starter-templates/clients.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// src/app/page.tsx
import { agent } from "~/lib/api";

export default async function Homepage() {
  const feeds = await agent.app.bsky.unspecced.getPopularFeedGenerators({
    limit: 10,
  });

  return (
    <div className="container mx-auto">
      <h1 className="font-bold text-xl my-4">Top Feeds</h1>

TITLE: Creating Facets for Mentions and Links in Bluesky Posts with Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python snippet demonstrates how to create facets for mentions and links in Bluesky posts. It parses the text for mentions and links, resolves mentions to DIDs, and constructs the facets array for the post record.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-08-11-create-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def parse_facets(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    facets = []
    for m in parse_mentions(text):
        resp = requests.get(
            "https://bsky.social/xrpc/com.atproto.identity.resolveHandle",
            params={"handle": m["handle"]},
        )
        if resp.status_code == 400:
            continue
        did = resp.json()["did"]
        facets.append({
            "index": {
                "byteStart": m["start"],
                "byteEnd": m["end"],
            },
            "features": [{"$type": "app.bsky.richtext.facet#mention", "did": did}],
        })
    for u in parse_urls(text):
        facets.append({
            "index": {
                "byteStart": u["start"],
                "byteEnd": u["end"],
            },
            "features": [
                {
                    "$type": "app.bsky.richtext.facet#link",
                    "uri": u["url"],
                }
            ],
        })
    return facets

post["text"] = "✨ example mentioning @atproto.com to share the URL 👨‍❤️‍👨 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CBOR."
post["facets"] = parse_facets(post["text"])
```

)
resp.raise_for_status()
blob = resp.json()["blob"]

TITLE: Creating Custom Agents by Extending Agent Instead of BskyAgent
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to migrate custom BskyAgent extensions to the new Agent class. The new approach provides a more flexible way to customize session handling and authentication with cleaner inheritance patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2024-08-12-ts-api-refactor/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BskyAgent } from '@atproto/api'

class MyAgent extends BskyAgent {
  private accessToken?: string

  async createOrRefreshSession(identifier: string, password: string) {
    // custom logic here

    this.accessToken = 'my-access-jwt'
  }

  async doStuff() {
    return this.call('io.example.doStuff', {
      headers: {
        'Authorization': this.accessToken && `Bearer ${this.accessToken}`
      }
    })
  }
}
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Agent } from '@atproto/api'

class MyAgent extends Agent {
  private accessToken?: string
  public did?: string

  constructor(private readonly service: string | URL) {
    super({
      service,
      headers: {
        Authorization: () =>
          this.accessToken ? `Bearer ${this.accessToken}` : null,
      }
    })
  }

  clone(): MyAgent {
    const agent = new MyAgent(this.service)
    agent.accessToken = this.accessToken
    agent.did = this.did
    return this.copyInto(agent)
  }

  async createOrRefreshSession(identifier: string, password: string) {
    // custom logic here

    this.did = 'did:example:123'
    this.accessToken = 'my-access-jwt'
  }
}
```

TITLE: Creating and Verifying Service JWT Tokens in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create and verify service JWT tokens using the @atproto/xrpc-server library. Includes examples of creating a JWT with the user's keypair and verifying a JWT by resolving the signing key from a DID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/service-auth.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
import { createServiceJwt, verifyServiceJwt } from '@atproto/xrpc-server'
import { IdResolver } from '@atproto/identity'

// Creating a service JWT
const keypair = // users keypair

const jwt = await createServiceJwt({
  iss: // usersDid
  aud: 'did:example:server',
  keypair,
})


// Verifying a service JWT
// helper method to resolve a user's DID to their atproto signing key
const idResolver = new IdResolver()
const getSigningKey = async (
  did: string,
  forceRefresh: boolean,
): Promise<string> => {
  return this.idResolver.did.resolveAtprotoKey(did, forceRefresh)
}

// it is important to always check the audience of the provided service JWT
const payload = await verifyServiceJwt(jwt, 'did:example:server', getSigningKey)
```

TITLE: Implementing Client-Side Rate Limiting with FetchHandler
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to migrate from monkey patching the xrpc service client to using a custom FetchHandler for rate limiting. The new approach provides a cleaner extension pattern by subclassing the AtpAgent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2024-08-12-ts-api-refactor/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BskyAgent } from '@atproto/api'
import { RateLimitThreshold } from "rate-limit-threshold"

const agent = new BskyAgent()
const limiter = new RateLimitThreshold(
  3000,
  300_000
)

const origCall = agent.api.xrpc.call
agent.api.xrpc.call = async function (...args) {
  await limiter.wait()
  return origCall.call(this, ...args)
}
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { AtpAgent } from '@atproto/api'
import { RateLimitThreshold } from "rate-limit-threshold"

class LimitedAtpAgent extends AtpAgent {
  constructor(options: AtpAgentOptions) {
    const fetch = options.fetch ?? globalThis.fetch
    const limiter = new RateLimitThreshold(
      3000,
      300_000
    )

    super({
      ...options,
      fetch: async (...args) => {
        await limiter.wait()
        return fetch(...args)
      }
    })
  }
}
```

TITLE: Automated Posting Bot Implementation
DESCRIPTION: TypeScript implementation of a Bluesky bot that posts an emoji every three hours using the BskyAgent API and cron scheduling. Includes authentication, posting functionality, and scheduled execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/starter-templates/bots.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BskyAgent } from '@atproto/api';
import * as dotenv from 'dotenv';
import { CronJob } from 'cron';
import * as process from 'process';

dotenv.config();

// Create a Bluesky Agent 
const agent = new BskyAgent({
    service: 'https://bsky.social',
  })


async function main() {
    await agent.login({ identifier: process.env.BLUESKY_USERNAME!, password: process.env.BLUESKY_PASSWORD!})
    await agent.post({
        text: "🙂"
    });
    console.log("Just posted!")
}

main();


// Run this on a cron job
const scheduleExpressionMinute = '* * * * *'; // Run once every minute for testing
const scheduleExpression = '0 */3 * * *'; // Run once every three hours in prod

const job = new CronJob(scheduleExpression, main); // change to scheduleExpressionMinute for testing

job.start();
```

TITLE: Creating a Simple Bluesky Post in Python
DESCRIPTION: Python script that creates a basic Bluesky post with text and timestamp, then sends it to the API using the createRecord endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import json
from datetime import datetime, timezone

# Fetch the current time
# Using a trailing "Z" is preferred over the "+00:00" format
now = datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat().replace("+00:00", "Z")

# Required fields that each post must include
post = {
    "$type": "app.bsky.feed.post",
    "text": "Hello World!",
    "createdAt": now,
}

resp = requests.post(
    pds_url + "/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.createRecord",
    headers={"Authorization": "Bearer " + session["accessJwt"]},
    json={
        "repo": session["did"],
        "collection": "app.bsky.feed.post",
        "record": post,
    },
)
print(json.dumps(resp.json(), indent=2))
resp.raise_for_status()
```

TITLE: Creating Rich-Text Facets for Mentions and Links
DESCRIPTION: Python function that converts parsed mentions and URLs into rich-text facets for a Bluesky post, including handle resolution for mentions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Parse facets from text and resolve the handles to DIDs
def parse_facets(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    facets = []
    for m in parse_mentions(text):
        resp = requests.get(
            pds_url + "/xrpc/com.atproto.identity.resolveHandle",
            params={"handle": m["handle"]},
        )
        # If the handle can't be resolved, just skip it!
        # It will be rendered as text in the post instead of a link
        if resp.status_code == 400:
            continue
        did = resp.json()["did"]
        facets.append({
            "index": {
                "byteStart": m["start"],
                "byteEnd": m["end"],
            },
            "features": [{"$type": "app.bsky.richtext.facet#mention", "did": did}],
        })
    for u in parse_urls(text):
        facets.append({
            "index": {
                "byteStart": u["start"],
                "byteEnd": u["end"],
            },
            "features": [
                {
                    "$type": "app.bsky.richtext.facet#link",
                    # NOTE: URI ("I") not URL ("L")
                    "uri": u["url"],
                }
            ],
        })
    return facets
```

TITLE: Customizing HTTP Headers with Custom Fetch Function
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to migrate from static fetch handler configuration to providing a custom fetch function that modifies headers. This approach provides a cleaner way to customize all outgoing requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2024-08-12-ts-api-refactor/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BskyAgent, defaultFetchHandler } from '@atproto/api'

BskyAgent.configure({
  fetch: async (httpUri, httpMethod, httpHeaders, httpReqBody) => {

    const ua = httpHeaders["User-Agent"]

    httpHeaders["User-Agent"] = ua ? `${ua} ${userAgent}` : userAgent

    return defaultFetchHandler(httpUri, httpMethod, httpHeaders, httpReqBody)
  }
})
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { AtpAgent } from '@atproto/api'

class MyAtpAgent extends AtpAgent {
  constructor(options: AtpAgentOptions) {
    const fetch = options.fetch ?? globalThis.fetch

    super({
      ...options,
      fetch: async (url, init) => {
        const headers = new Headers(init.headers)

        const ua = headersList.get("User-Agent")
        headersList.set("User-Agent", ua ? `${ua} ${userAgent}` : userAgent)

        return fetch(url, { ...init, headers })
      }
    })
  }
}
```

      "format": "date-time"
    },
    "sig": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "byte",
      "description": "Signature of dag-cbor encoded label."
    }
  }
}

import { XrpcClient } from '@atproto/xrpc'

const instance = new XrpcClient(

    service: () => 'http://my-service.com',

      'my-ignored-header': () => null, // ignored

      id: 'io.example.doStuff',

)

TITLE: Defining User Preferences Schema for Bluesky API in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This schema defines the structure for user preferences in the Bluesky social network API. It includes various preference types such as content labels, saved feeds, personal details, feed view settings, thread view preferences, muted words, and app-specific states.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/app-bsky-actor-put-preferences.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "required": true,
  "content": {
    "application/json": {
      "schema": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": ["preferences"],
        "properties": {
          "preferences": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "oneOf": [
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["enabled"],
                  "properties": {
                    "enabled": {"type": "boolean"}
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.adultContentPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["label", "visibility"],
                  "properties": {
                    "labelerDid": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "description": "Which labeler does this preference apply to? If undefined, applies globally.",
                      "format": "did"
                    },
                    "label": {"type": "string"},
                    "visibility": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "enum": ["ignore", "show", "warn", "hide"]
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.contentLabelPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["pinned", "saved"],
                  "properties": {
                    "pinned": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {"type": "string", "format": "at-uri"}
                    },
                    "saved": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {"type": "string", "format": "at-uri"}
                    },
                    "timelineIndex": {"type": "integer"}
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.savedFeedsPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["items"],
                  "properties": {
                    "items": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "required": ["id", "type", "value", "pinned"],
                        "properties": {
                          "id": {"type": "string"},
                          "type": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "enum": ["feed", "list", "timeline"]
                          },
                          "value": {"type": "string"},
                          "pinned": {"type": "boolean"}
                        },
                        "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.savedFeed"
                      }
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.savedFeedsPrefV2"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "properties": {
                    "birthDate": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "description": "The birth date of account owner.",
                      "format": "date-time"
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.personalDetailsPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["feed"],
                  "properties": {
                    "feed": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "description": "The URI of the feed, or an identifier which describes the feed."
                    },
                    "hideReplies": {
                      "type": "boolean",
                      "description": "Hide replies in the feed."
                    },
                    "hideRepliesByUnfollowed": {
                      "type": "boolean",
                      "description": "Hide replies in the feed if they are not by followed users.",
                      "default": true
                    },
                    "hideRepliesByLikeCount": {"type": "integer"},
                    "hideReposts": {
                      "type": "boolean",
                      "description": "Hide reposts in the feed."
                    },
                    "hideQuotePosts": {
                      "type": "boolean",
                      "description": "Hide quote posts in the feed."
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.feedViewPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "properties": {
                    "sort": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "description": "Sorting mode for threads.",
                      "enum": ["oldest", "newest", "most-likes", "random", "hotness"]
                    },
                    "prioritizeFollowedUsers": {
                      "type": "boolean",
                      "description": "Show followed users at the top of all replies."
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.threadViewPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["tags"],
                  "properties": {
                    "tags": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {"type": "string", "maxLength": 640},
                      "maxItems": 100
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.interestsPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["items"],
                  "properties": {
                    "items": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "description": "A word that the account owner has muted.",
                        "required": ["value", "targets"],
                        "properties": {
                          "id": {"type": "string"},
                          "value": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "The muted word itself.",
                            "maxLength": 10000
                          },
                          "targets": {
                            "type": "array",
                            "items": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "maxLength": 640,
                              "enum": ["content", "tag"],
                              "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.mutedWordTarget"
                            }
                          },
                          "actorTarget": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "Groups of users to apply the muted word to. If undefined, applies to all users.",
                            "default": "all",
                            "enum": ["all", "exclude-following"]
                          },
                          "expiresAt": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "The date and time at which the muted word will expire and no longer be applied.",
                            "format": "date-time"
                          }
                        },
                        "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.mutedWord"
                      }
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.mutedWordsPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["items"],
                  "properties": {
                    "items": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {"type": "string", "format": "at-uri"}
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.hiddenPostsPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "description": "A grab bag of state that's specific to the bsky.app program. Third-party apps shouldn't use this.",
                  "properties": {
                    "activeProgressGuide": {
                      "type": "object",
                      "description": "If set, an active progress guide. Once completed, can be set to undefined. Should have unspecced fields tracking progress.",
                      "required": ["guide"],
                      "properties": {
                        "guide": {"type": "string", "maxLength": 100}
                      },
                      "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.bskyAppProgressGuide"
                    },
                    "queuedNudges": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {"type": "string", "maxLength": 100},
                      "maxItems": 1000
                    },
                    "nuxs": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "description": "A new user experiences (NUX) storage object",
                        "required": ["id", "completed"],
                        "properties": {
                          "id": {"type": "string", "maxLength": 100},
                          "completed": {"type": "boolean"},
                          "data": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "Arbitrary data for the NUX. The structure is defined by the NUX itself. Limited to 300 characters.",
                            "maxLength": 3000
                          },
                          "expiresAt": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "The date and time at which the NUX will expire and should be considered completed.",
                            "format": "date-time"
                          }
                        },
                        "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.nux"
                      },
                      "maxItems": 100
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.bskyAppStatePref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["labelers"],
                  "properties": {
                    "labelers": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "required": ["did"],
                        "properties": {
                          "did": {"type": "string", "format": "did"}
                        },
                        "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.labelerPrefItem"
                      }
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.actor.defs.labelersPref"
                },
                {
                  "type": "object",
                  "description": "Default post interaction settings for the account. These values should be applied as default values when creating new posts. These refs should mirror the threadgate and postgate records exactly.",
                  "required": [],
                  "properties": {
                    "threadgateAllowRules": {

                          {

                          },
                          {

                          {

                      },

}

TITLE: Parsing Mentions and Links for Bluesky Posts in Python
DESCRIPTION: This Python snippet defines functions to parse mentions and URLs in post text. It uses regular expressions to identify mentions and links, returning their start and end positions in the text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-08-11-create-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import re
from typing import List, Dict

def parse_mentions(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    spans = []
    mention_regex = rb"[$|\W](@([a-zA-Z0-9]([a-zA-Z0-9-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?\.)+[a-zA-Z]([a-zA-Z0-9-]{0,61}[a-zA-Z0-9])?)"
    text_bytes = text.encode("UTF-8")
    for m in re.finditer(mention_regex, text_bytes):
        spans.append({
            "start": m.start(1),
            "end": m.end(1),
            "handle": m.group(1)[1:].decode("UTF-8")
        })
    return spans

def parse_urls(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    spans = []
    url_regex = rb"[$|\W](https?:\/\/(www\.)?[-a-zA-Z0-9@:%._\+~#=]{1,256}\.[a-zA-Z0-9()]{1,6}\b([-a-zA-Z0-9()@:%_\+.~#?&//=]*[-a-zA-Z0-9@%_\+~#//=])?)"
    text_bytes = text.encode("UTF-8")
    for m in re.finditer(url_regex, text_bytes):
        spans.append({
            "start": m.start(1),
            "end": m.end(1),
            "url": m.group(1).decode("UTF-8"),
        })
    return spans
```

TITLE: Migrating from ServiceClient to XrpcClient in @atproto/xrpc
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to migrate from the deprecated Client and ServiceClient classes to the new XrpcClient class. This migration involves changing how service URLs and HTTP headers are configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2024-08-12-ts-api-refactor/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import client, { defaultFetchHandler } from '@atproto/xrpc'

client.fetch = function (
  httpUri: string,
  httpMethod: string,
  httpHeaders: Headers,
  httpReqBody: unknown,
) {
  // Custom logic here
  return defaultFetchHandler(httpUri, httpMethod, httpHeaders, httpReqBody)
}

client.addLexicon({
  lexicon: 1,
  id: 'io.example.doStuff',
  defs: {},
})

const instance = client.service('http://my-service.com')

instance.setHeader('my-header', 'my-value')

await instance.call('io.example.doStuff')
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { XrpcClient } from '@atproto/xrpc'

const instance = new XrpcClient(
  async (url, init) => {
    const headers = new Headers(init.headers)

    headers.set('my-header', 'my-value')

    // Custom logic here

    const fullUrl = new URL(url, 'http://my-service.com')

    return fetch(fullUrl, { ...init, headers })
  },
  [
    {
      lexicon: 1,
      id: 'io.example.doStuff',
      defs: {},
    },
  ],
)

await instance.call('io.example.doStuff')
```

TITLE: Updating List Metadata in Bluesky API
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet shows how to update a list's metadata using the Bluesky API. It retrieves the current record, modifies the fields, and then updates the record.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/tutorials/user-lists.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const {repo, collection, rkey} = new AtUri(listUri)

// get the current record
const {value: record} = await agent.com.atproto.repo.getRecord({repo, collection, rkey})

// modify the fields
record.name = newName
record.description = newDescription
// etc

await agent.com.atproto.repo.putRecord({
  repo: currentAccount.did,
  collection,
  rkey,
  record,
})
```

TITLE: Retrieving Reply References in Python for Bluesky API
DESCRIPTION: This function fetches the necessary reference information for a reply post, including the root and parent post details. It handles cases where the parent is a top-level post or a reply itself.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def get_reply_refs(parent_uri: str) -> Dict:
    uri_parts = parse_uri(parent_uri)

    resp = requests.get(
        pds_url + "/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.getRecord",
        params=uri_parts,
    )
    resp.raise_for_status()
    parent = resp.json()

    parent_reply = parent["value"].get("reply")
    if parent_reply is not None:
        root_uri = parent_reply["root"]["uri"]
        root_repo, root_collection, root_rkey = root_uri.split("/")[2:5]
        resp = requests.get(
            pds_url + "/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.getRecord",
            params={
                "repo": root_repo,
                "collection": root_collection,
                "rkey": root_rkey,
            },
        )
        resp.raise_for_status()
        root = resp.json()
    else:
        # The parent record is a top-level post, so it is also the root
        root = parent

    return {
        "root": {
            "uri": root["uri"],
            "cid": root["cid"],
        },
        "parent": {
            "uri": parent["uri"],
            "cid": parent["cid"],
        },
    }
```

TITLE: Viewing a List in Bluesky API
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet shows how to use the Bluesky API to view a list and its members. It demonstrates pagination through the full list using a cursor.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/tutorials/user-lists.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import {AppBskyGraphDefs} from '@atproto/api'

let cursor: string | undefined
let members: AppBskyGraphDefs.ListItemView[] = []
do {
  let res = await agent.app.bsky.graph.getList({
    list: uri,
    limit: 30,
    cursor
  })
  cursor = res.data.cursor
  members = members.concat(res.data.items)
} while (cursor)
```

TITLE: Resolving AT Protocol Identity
DESCRIPTION: Go code to resolve an AT Protocol identifier to a DID document and find the PDS endpoint using the indigo SDK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-11-06-repo-export.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
import (
    "fmt"
    "context"

    "github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/atproto/identity"
    "github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/atproto/syntax"
    "github.com/bluesky-social/indigo/xrpc"
)

func main() {
    run()
}

func run() error {
    ctx := context.Background()
    atid, err := syntax.ParseAtIdentifier("atproto.com")
    if err != nil {
        return err
    }

    dir := identity.DefaultDirectory()
    ident, err := dir.Lookup(ctx, *atid)
    if err != nil {
        return err
    }

    if ident.PDSEndpoint() == "" {
        return fmt.Errorf("no PDS endpoint for identity")
    }

    fmt.Println(ident.PDSEndpoint())
}
```

TITLE: Fetching and Embedding Website Card in Bluesky Post using Python
DESCRIPTION: This function fetches metadata for a website URL, including title, description, and thumbnail image, then structures it for embedding in a Bluesky post.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def fetch_embed_url_card(access_token: str, url: str) -> Dict:

    # the required fields for every embed card
    card = {
        "uri": url,
        "title": "",
        "description": "",
    }

    # fetch the HTML
    resp = requests.get(url)
    resp.raise_for_status()
    soup = BeautifulSoup(resp.text, "html.parser")

    # parse out the "og:title" and "og:description" HTML meta tags
    title_tag = soup.find("meta", property="og:title")
    if title_tag:
        card["title"] = title_tag["content"]
    description_tag = soup.find("meta", property="og:description")
    if description_tag:
        card["description"] = description_tag["content"]

    # if there is an "og:image" HTML meta tag, fetch and upload that image
    image_tag = soup.find("meta", property="og:image")
    if image_tag:
        img_url = image_tag["content"]
        # naively turn a "relative" URL (just a path) into a full URL, if needed
        if "://" not in img_url:
            img_url = url + img_url
        resp = requests.get(img_url)
        resp.raise_for_status()

        blob_resp = requests.post(
            pds_url + "/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.uploadBlob",
            headers={
                "Content-Type": IMAGE_MIMETYPE,
                "Authorization": "Bearer " + access_token,
            },
            data=resp.content,
        )
        blob_resp.raise_for_status()
        card["thumb"] = blob_resp.json()["blob"]

    return {
        "$type": "app.bsky.embed.external",
        "external": card,
    }
```

TITLE: Setting Thread Gate Rules in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Creates a thread gate record with multiple rules to control reply permissions. Shows how to allow replies from mentioned users, followed users, and list members. Also demonstrates creating an empty thread gate to prevent all replies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/tutorials/thread-gates.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const {rkey} = new AtUri(postUri)

await agent.com.atproto.repo.createRecord({
  repo: agent.session.did,
  collection: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate',
  rkey,
  record: {
    $type: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate',
    post: postUri,
    allow: [
      // allow mentioned users
      {$type: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate#mentionRule'},
      // allow followed users
      {$type: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate#followingRule'},
      // allow list members
      {$type: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate#listRule', list: listUri},
    ],
    createdAt: new Date().toISOString()
  }
})
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
await agent.com.atproto.repo.createRecord({
  repo: agent.session.did,
  collection: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate',
  rkey,
  record: {
    $type: 'app.bsky.feed.threadgate',
    post: postUri,
    // empty allow-list, nobody can reply
    allow: [],
    createdAt: new Date().toISOString()
  }
})
```

    },
    {
      "name": "sortDirection",

      "required": false,
      "schema": {

        "description": "Retrieve events created after a given timestamp",

      }
    },
    {
      "name": "createdBefore",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "Retrieve events created before a given timestamp",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "Retrieve events created before a given timestamp",
        "format": "date-time"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "subject",
      "in": "query",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "format": "uri"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "collections",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events where the subject belongs to the given collections will be returned. When subjectType is set to 'account', this will be ignored.",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "nsid"
        },
        "maxItems": 20
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "subjectType",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events where the subject is of the given type (account or record) will be returned. When this is set to 'account' the 'collections' parameter will be ignored. When includeAllUserRecords or subject is set, this will be ignored.",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "If specified, only events where the subject is of the given type (account or record) will be returned. When this is set to 'account' the 'collections' parameter will be ignored. When includeAllUserRecords or subject is set, this will be ignored.",

          "record"

      }

      "in": "query",
      "description": "If true, events on all record types (posts, lists, profile etc.) or records from given 'collections' param, owned by the did are returned.",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "boolean",
        "description": "If true, events on all record types (posts, lists, profile etc.) or records from given 'collections' param, owned by the did are returned."
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "limit",

      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "integer",
        "minimum": 1,
        "maximum": 100,

    },
    {

      "description": "If true, only events with comments are returned",

      "schema": {

        "description": "If true, only events with comments are returned"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "comment",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events with comments containing the keyword are returned. Apply || separator to use multiple keywords and match using OR condition.",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "If specified, only events with comments containing the keyword are returned. Apply || separator to use multiple keywords and match using OR condition."
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "addedLabels",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events where all of these labels were added are returned",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "removedLabels",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events where all of these labels were removed are returned",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "addedTags",
      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events where all of these tags were added are returned",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    {

      "in": "query",
      "description": "If specified, only events where all of these tags were removed are returned",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "reportTypes",
      "in": "query",
      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    {

      "required": false,
      "schema": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "If specified, only events where the action policies match any of the given policies are returned"

      }
    },
    {

        "type": "string"

TITLE: Defining Request Body Schema for atproto Repository Writes

SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/com-atproto-repo-apply-writes.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["repo", "writes"],
  "properties": {
    "repo": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The handle or DID of the repo (aka, current account).",
      "format": "at-identifier"
    },
    "validate": {
      "type": "boolean",
      "description": "Can be set to 'false' to skip Lexicon schema validation of record data across all operations, 'true' to require it, or leave unset to validate only for known Lexicons."
    },
    "writes": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "oneOf": [
          {
            "type": "object",
            "description": "Operation which creates a new record.",
            "required": ["collection", "value"],
            "properties": {
              "collection": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "nsid"
              },
              "rkey": {
                "type": "string",
                "description": "NOTE: maxLength is redundant with record-key format. Keeping it temporarily to ensure backwards compatibility.",
                "format": "record-key",
                "maxLength": 512
              },
              "value": {}
            },
            "title": "com.atproto.repo.applyWrites.create"
          },
          {
            "type": "object",
            "description": "Operation which updates an existing record.",
            "required": ["collection", "rkey", "value"],
            "properties": {
              "collection": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "nsid"
              },
              "rkey": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "record-key"
              },
              "value": {}
            },
            "title": "com.atproto.repo.applyWrites.update"
          },
          {
            "type": "object",
            "description": "Operation which deletes an existing record.",
            "required": ["collection", "rkey"],
            "properties": {
              "collection": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "nsid"
              },
              "rkey": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "record-key"
              }
            },
            "title": "com.atproto.repo.applyWrites.delete"
          }
        ]
      }
    },
    "swapCommit": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "If provided, the entire operation will fail if the current repo commit CID does not match this value. Used to prevent conflicting repo mutations.",
      "format": "cid"
    }
  }
}

TITLE: Converting Records to JSON
DESCRIPTION: Go code to convert CAR file records to JSON format and save them to disk.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-11-06-repo-export.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
// where to write out data on local disk
recPath := topDir + "/" + k
os.MkdirAll(filepath.Dir(recPath), os.ModePerm)
if err != nil {
    return err
}


// fetch the record CBOR and convert to a golang struct
_, rec, err := r.GetRecord(ctx, k)
if err != nil {
    return err
}

// serialize as JSON
recJson, err := json.MarshalIndent(rec, "", "  ")
if err != nil {
    return err
}

if err := os.WriteFile(recPath+".json", recJson, 0666); err != nil {
    return err
}

return nil
```

TITLE: Defining API Response Schema for Bluesky Social Conversations

{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["did", "messages", "muted", "status", "unreadCount"],
  "properties": {
    "did": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "did"
    },
    "messages": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": ["message"],
        "properties": {
          "message": {
            "type": "object",
            "required": ["id", "text", "sender", "sentAt"],
            "properties": {
              "id": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "text": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "embeds": {
                "type": "array",

                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["$type", "record"],
                  "properties": {
                    "$type": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "const": "app.bsky.embed.record#view"
                    },
                    "record": {
                      "type": "object"
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "app.bsky.embed.record.view"
                }
              },
              "reactions": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "required": ["value", "sender", "createdAt"],
                  "properties": {
                    "value": {
                      "type": "string"
                    },
                    "sender": {
                      "type": "object",
                      "required": ["did"],
                      "properties": {
                        "did": {
                          "type": "string",
                          "format": "did"
                        }
                      },
                      "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.reactionViewSender"
                    },
                    "createdAt": {
                      "type": "string",
                      "format": "date-time"
                    }
                  },
                  "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.reactionView"
                }
              },
              "sender": {
                "type": "object",
                "required": ["did"],
                "properties": {
                  "did": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "format": "did"
                  }
                },
                "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.messageViewSender"
              },
              "sentAt": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "date-time"
              }
            },
            "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.messageView"
          },
          "reaction": {
            "type": "object",
            "required": ["value", "sender", "createdAt"],
            "properties": {
              "value": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "sender": {
                "type": "object",
                "required": ["did"],
                "properties": {
                  "did": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "format": "did"
                  }
                },
                "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.reactionViewSender"
              },
              "createdAt": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "date-time"
              }
            },
            "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.reactionView"
          }
        },
        "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.messageAndReactionView"
      }
    },
    "muted": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "status": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": ["request", "accepted"]
    },
    "unreadCount": {
      "type": "integer"
    }
  },
  "title": "chat.bsky.convo.defs.convoView"
}

                                                          "createdAt": {"type": "string", "description": "Timestamp when the verification was created.", "format": "date-time"}
                                                        },

                                                      }
                                                    },

                                                    },

                                                      "enum": ["valid", "invalid", "none"]
                                                    }
                                                  },

TITLE: Uploading an Image for Bluesky Post Embed in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code reads an image file, checks its size, and uploads it to the Bluesky API, returning a blob object for embedding in a post.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
IMAGE_PATH = "./example.png"
IMAGE_MIMETYPE = "image/png"
IMAGE_ALT_TEXT = "brief alt text description of the image"

with open(IMAGE_PATH, "rb") as f:
    img_bytes = f.read()

# this size limit is specified in the app.bsky.embed.images lexicon
if len(img_bytes) > 1000000:
    raise Exception(
        f"image file size too large. 1000000 bytes maximum, got: {len(img_bytes)}"
    )

# TODO: strip EXIF metadata here, if needed

resp = requests.post(
    pds_url + "/xrpc/com.atproto.repo.uploadBlob",
    headers={
        "Content-Type": IMAGE_MIMETYPE,
        "Authorization": "Bearer " + session["accessJwt"],
    },
    data=img_bytes,
)
resp.raise_for_status()
blob = resp.json()["blob"]
```

TITLE: Querying Account Invite Codes in atproto API
DESCRIPTION: This API endpoint retrieves all invite codes for the authenticated user's account. It accepts optional query parameters to include used codes and create available codes. The response contains an array of invite code objects with details like code, availability, creation info, and usage history.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/com-atproto-server-get-account-invite-codes.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "codes": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "available": 0,
      "disabled": false,
      "forAccount": "string",
      "createdBy": "string",
      "createdAt": "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z",
      "uses": [
        {
          "usedBy": "did:example:123",
          "usedAt": "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

TITLE: Defining Request Parameters for Finding Related Accounts
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the required and optional query parameters for the API request, including the DID of the root account, pagination cursor, and result limit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/tools-ozone-signature-find-related-accounts.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "name": "did",
  "in": "query",
  "required": true,
  "schema": {
    "type": "string",
    "format": "did"
  }
},
{
  "name": "cursor",
  "in": "query",
  "required": false,
  "schema": {
    "type": "string"
  }
},
{
  "name": "limit",
  "in": "query",
  "required": false,
  "schema": {
    "type": "integer",
    "minimum": 1,
    "maximum": 100,
    "default": 50
  }
}
```

TITLE: Querying Reporter Stats in Ozone Moderation API (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the JSON schema for the response of the getReporterStats endpoint. It includes an array of reporter statistics for each requested user, containing counts of reports, reported content, and moderation actions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/tools-ozone-moderation-get-reporter-stats.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["stats"],
  "properties": {
    "stats": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "did",
          "accountReportCount",
          "recordReportCount",
          "reportedAccountCount",
          "reportedRecordCount",
          "takendownAccountCount",
          "takendownRecordCount",
          "labeledAccountCount",
          "labeledRecordCount"
        ],
        "properties": {
          "did": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "did"
          },
          "accountReportCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "recordReportCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "reportedAccountCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "reportedRecordCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "takendownAccountCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "takendownRecordCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "labeledAccountCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          },
          "labeledRecordCount": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        },
        "title": "tools.ozone.moderation.defs.reporterStats"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining Request Body Schema for Record Deletion in JSON
DESCRIPTION: JSON schema defining the required fields for the request body when deleting a record from an atproto repository. It specifies the repo, collection, and record key, with optional fields for swap operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/com-atproto-repo-delete-record.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["repo", "collection", "rkey"],
  "properties": {
    "repo": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The handle or DID of the repo (aka, current account).",
      "format": "at-identifier"
    },
    "collection": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The NSID of the record collection.",
      "format": "nsid"
    },
    "rkey": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The Record Key.",
      "format": "record-key"
    },
    "swapRecord": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Compare and swap with the previous record by CID.",
      "format": "cid"
    },
    "swapCommit": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Compare and swap with the previous commit by CID.",
      "format": "cid"
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Request Body Schema for com.atproto.repo.putRecord
DESCRIPTION: JSON schema defining the required and optional parameters for the request body of the com.atproto.repo.putRecord endpoint. It includes fields for repo, collection, rkey, record, and optional validation and swap parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/com-atproto-repo-put-record.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["repo", "collection", "rkey", "record"],
  "properties": {
    "repo": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The handle or DID of the repo (aka, current account).",
      "format": "at-identifier"
    },
    "collection": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The NSID of the record collection.",
      "format": "nsid"
    },
    "rkey": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "The Record Key.",
      "format": "record-key",
      "maxLength": 512
    },
    "validate": {
      "type": "boolean",
      "description": "Can be set to 'false' to skip Lexicon schema validation of record data, 'true' to require it, or leave unset to validate only for known Lexicons."
    },
    "record": {},
    "swapRecord": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Compare and swap with the previous record by CID. WARNING: nullable and optional field; may cause problems with golang implementation",
      "format": "cid"
    },
    "swapCommit": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Compare and swap with the previous commit by CID.",
      "format": "cid"
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining Report Response Schema in JSON
DESCRIPTION: JSON schema for the response body when a moderation report is successfully submitted. Includes fields like id, reasonType, subject, reportedBy, and createdAt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/com-atproto-moderation-create-report.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["id", "reasonType", "subject", "reportedBy", "createdAt"],
  "properties": {
    "id": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "reasonType": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Spam: frequent unwanted promotion, replies, mentions",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonSpam"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Direct violation of server rules, laws, terms of service",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonViolation"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Misleading identity, affiliation, or content",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonMisleading"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Unwanted or mislabeled sexual content",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonSexual"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Rude, harassing, explicit, or otherwise unwelcoming behavior",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonRude"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Other: reports not falling under another report category",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonOther"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "token",
          "description": "Appeal: appeal a previously taken moderation action",
          "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonAppeal"
        }
      ],
      "title": "com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonType"
    },
    "reason": {
      "type": "string",
      "maxLength": 20000
    },
    "subject": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "object",
          "required": ["did"],
          "properties": {
            "did": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "did"
            }
          },
          "title": "com.atproto.admin.defs.repoRef"
        },
        {
          "type": "object",
          "required": ["uri", "cid"],
          "properties": {
            "uri": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "at-uri"
            },
            "cid": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "cid"
            }
          },
          "title": "com.atproto.repo.strongRef"
        }
      ]
    },
    "reportedBy": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "did"
    },
    "createdAt": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "date-time"
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Thread Data Structure Interface
DESCRIPTION: Defines the TypeScript interface for thread view post data structure, showing the relationships between posts, their parents, and replies. Includes handling for not found and blocked posts.

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface ThreadViewPost {\n    post: PostView;\n    parent?: ThreadViewPost | NotFoundPost | BlockedPost | {\n        $type: string;\n        [k: string]: unknown;\n    };\n    replies?: (ThreadViewPost | NotFoundPost | BlockedPost | {\n        $type: string;\n        [k: string]: unknown;\n    })[];\n}
```

TITLE: Example of Type Discrimination Using $type Property (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how the $type property can be used to discriminate between different types of embeds in a Bluesky post, providing proper type inference.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2025-02-13-typescript-sdk-release.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { AppBskyFeedPost } from '@atproto/api'

// Say we got some random post somehow (typically
// via an API call)
declare const post: AppBskyFeedPost.Main

// And we want to know what kind of embed it contains
const { embed } = post

// We can now use the `$type` property to disambiguate
if (embed?.$type === 'app.bsky.embed.images') {
  // The `embed` variable is fully typed as
  // `$Typed<AppBskyEmbedImages.Main>` here!
}
```

TITLE: Defining Conversation Response Schema in JSON
DESCRIPTION: JSON schema defining the structure of the response returned by the chat.bsky.convo.getConvo endpoint. It includes conversation ID, revision, members, mute status, and unread count.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/chat-bsky-convo-get-convo.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["convo"],
  "properties": {
    "convo": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["id", "rev", "members", "muted", "unreadCount"],
      "properties": {
        "id": {"type": "string"},
        "rev": {"type": "string"},
        "members": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "object",
            "required": ["did", "handle"],
            "properties": {
              "did": {"type": "string", "format": "did"},
              "handle": {"type": "string", "format": "handle"},
              "displayName": {"type": "string", "maxLength": 640},
              "avatar": {"type": "string", "format": "uri"}
            }
          }
        },
        "muted": {"type": "boolean"},
        "unreadCount": {"type": "integer"}
      }
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: API Endpoint Definition in Markdown

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# app.bsky.feed.getRepostedBy

*This endpoint is part of the Bluesky application Lexicon APIs (`app.bsky.*`). Public endpoints which don't require authentication can be made directly against the public Bluesky AppView API: https://public.api.bsky.app. Authenticated requests are usually made to the user's PDS, with automatic service proxying. Authenticated requests can be used for both public and non-public endpoints.*

*To learn more about calling atproto API endpoints like this one, see the [API Hosts and Auth](/docs/advanced-guides/api-directory) guide.*

Get a list of reposts for a given post.

TITLE: Defining Response Schema for Related Accounts
DESCRIPTION: Outlines the structure of the successful response, including an array of related accounts with their details and similarities to the root account.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/tools-ozone-signature-find-related-accounts.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["accounts"],
  "properties": {
    "cursor": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "accounts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": ["account"],
        "properties": {
          "account": {
            "type": "object",
            "required": ["did", "handle", "indexedAt"],
            "properties": {
              "did": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "did"
              },
              "handle": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "handle"
              },
              "indexedAt": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "date-time"
              }
            }
          },
          "similarities": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "type": "object",
              "required": ["property", "value"],
              "properties": {
                "property": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "value": {
                  "type": "string"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Using asPredicate Function for Type Checking
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the use of the new asPredicate function. It shows how to convert a validate* function into a predicate function, which can be useful when working with libraries that expect a predicate function as an argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2025-02-13-typescript-sdk-release.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { asPredicate, AppBskyEmbedImages } from '@atproto/api'

// Aliased for clarity
const Images = AppBskyEmbedImages.Main
const isValidImages = asPredicate(AppBskyEmbedImages.validateMain)

// Get an embed with unknown validity somehow
declare const embed: unknown

// The following condition will be true if, and only
// if, the value matches the `Image` interface.
if (isValidImages(embed)) {
  // `embed` is of type `Images` here
}

// Similarly, the type predicate can be used to
// infer the type of an array of unknown values:
declare const someArray: unknown[]

// This will be typed as `Images[]`
const images = someArray.filter(isValidImages)
```

TITLE: Downloading Repository to CAR File
DESCRIPTION: Go code to download a repository from the PDS endpoint and save it as a CAR file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-11-06-repo-export.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
carPath := ident.DID.String() + ".car"

xrpcc := xrpc.Client{
    Host: ident.PDSEndpoint(),
}

repoBytes, err := comatproto.SyncGetRepo(ctx, &xrpcc, ident.DID.String(), "")
if err != nil {
    return err
}

err = os.WriteFile(carPath, repoBytes, 0666)
if err != nil {
    return err
}
```

TITLE: Moderation Configuration Options in Bluesky TypeScript SDK
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration object for moderation functions in the Bluesky SDK. It includes user DID, moderation preferences, adult content settings, label settings, and subscribed labelers with their respective label preferences.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/advanced-guides/moderation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
{
  // the logged-in user's DID
  userDid: 'did:plc:1234...',

  moderationPrefs: {
    // is adult content allowed?
    adultContentEnabled: true,

    // the global label settings (used on self-labels)
    labels: {
      porn: 'hide',
      sexual: 'warn',
      nudity: 'ignore',
      // ...
    },

    // the subscribed labelers and their label settings
    labelers: [
      {
        did: 'did:plc:1234...',
        labels: {
          porn: 'hide',
          sexual: 'warn',
          nudity: 'ignore',
          // ...
        }
      }
    ],

    mutedWords: [/* ... */],
    hiddenPosts: [/* ... */]
  },

  // custom label definitions
  labelDefs: {
    // labelerDid => defs[]
    'did:plc:1234...': [
      /* ... */
    ]
  }
}
```

  "type": "object",
  "description": "Metadata tag on an atproto resource (eg, repo or record).",
  "required": ["src", "uri", "val", "cts"],
  "properties": {
    "ver": { "type": "integer" },
    "src": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "DID of the actor who created this label.",
      "format": "did"
    },
    "uri": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "AT URI of the record, repository (account), or other resource that this label applies to.",
      "format": "uri"
    },
    "cid": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Optionally, CID specifying the specific version of 'uri' resource this label applies to.",
      "format": "cid"
    },

      "type": "string",
      "description": "The short string name of the value or type of this label.",
      "maxLength": 128
    },
    "neg": {
      "type": "boolean",
      "description": "If true, this is a negation label, overwriting a previous label."
    },
    "cts": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Timestamp when this label was created.",
      "format": "date-time"
    },
    "exp": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Timestamp at which this label expires (no longer applies).",
      "format": "date-time"
    },
    "sig": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "byte",
      "description": "Signature of dag-cbor encoded label."
    }
  },
  "title": "com.atproto.label.defs.label"
}

TITLE: Deleting User Session with POST Request in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to make a POST request to delete the current user session using the com.atproto.server.deleteSession endpoint. It requires authentication and is called directly on the user's PDS instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/docs/api/com-atproto-server-delete-session.api.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
fetch('/xrpc/com.atproto.server.deleteSession', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN'
  }
})
.then(response => {
  if (response.ok) {
    console.log('Session deleted successfully');
  } else {
    console.error('Failed to delete session');
  }
})
.catch(error => {
  console.error('Error:', error);
});
```

TITLE: Implementing Blob Download in Go with ATProto
DESCRIPTION: A Go function that downloads all blobs associated with an ATProto account. The function resolves the account's PDS endpoint, lists all blob CIDs, and downloads each blob to a local directory. It includes pagination handling and skips already downloaded files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/bsky-docs/blob/main/blog/2023-11-06-repo-export.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func blobDownloadAll(raw string) error {
    ctx := context.Background()
    atid, err := syntax.ParseAtIdentifier(raw)
    if err != nil {
        return err
    }

    // resolve the DID document and PDS for this account
    dir := identity.DefaultDirectory()
    ident, err := dir.Lookup(ctx, *atid)
    if err != nil {
        return err
    }

    // create a new API client to connect to the account's PDS
    xrpcc := xrpc.Client{
        Host: ident.PDSEndpoint(),
    }
    if xrpcc.Host == "" {
        return fmt.Errorf("no PDS endpoint for identity")
    }

    topDir := ident.DID.String() + "/_blob"
    os.MkdirAll(topDir, os.ModePerm)

    // blob-specific part starts here!
    cursor := ""
    for {
        // loop over batches of CIDs
        resp, err := comatproto.SyncListBlobs(ctx, &xrpcc, cursor, ident.DID.String(), 500, "")
        if err != nil {
            return err
        }
        for _, cidStr := range resp.Cids {
            // if the file already exists, skip
            blobPath := topDir + "/" + cidStr
            if _, err := os.Stat(blobPath); err == nil {
                continue
            }

            // download the entire blob in to memory, then write to disk
            blobBytes, err := comatproto.SyncGetBlob(ctx, &xrpcc, cidStr, ident.DID.String())
            if err != nil {
                return err
            }
            if err := os.WriteFile(blobPath, blobBytes, 0666); err != nil {
                return err
            }
        }

        // a cursor in the result means there are more CIDs to enumerate
        if resp.Cursor != nil && *resp.Cursor != "" {
            cursor = *resp.Cursor
        } else {
            break
        }
    }
    return nil
}
```
